source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Euphorbiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Euphorbiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves linear to narrow-lanceolate, margins recurved to revolute; flowers 2–3 mm diam.; dwarf, short-lived perennial shrub from the Grampians, Brisbane and Pyrete Ranges and far East Gippsland
Leaves spathulate to obovate, margins more or less flat; flowers less than 2 mm diam.; small herbs
Plants dioecious, perennial, with annual stems dying back to rootstock; alps and subalps of eastern Victoria
Plants monoecious, annual; lowlands to subalps
Seeds smooth; plants compact; leaves mostly >11 mm long; north-west Victoria only
Seeds tuberculate; plants often diffuse; leaves <11 mm long; widespread
